Key Match Events: Travis Jankowski robbed Andrew Vaughn of a game-winning homer with a leaping catch in the ninth inning.
Corey Seager had four hits, including a tiebreaking single in the ninth.
Wyatt Langford hit a three-run homer in the second game for Texas.
Grant Anderson got one out for his first career save.
Marcus Semien hit a tiebreaking RBI double for Texas in the seventh inning of the first game.
Post-Match Reflections: Following another heartbreaking loss, Vaughn credited Jankowski for his play, calling it 'probably one of the best catches you’ll see in a long time.'
Interim manager Grady Sizemore said, 'That’s a tough game to lose. We played well, did everything right. They got some key hits when they needed it and stole one from us at a good time.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rangers manager Bruce Bochy mentioned having to tone down his comments due to the lack of fans in the stands during the resumed game.
Rangers left-hander Andrew Heaney allowed five hits in five innings and mentioned it was not his best stuff but he competed to give his team a chance to win.
Others: Rangers: Jacob deGrom's second minor league rehab start went well, and he went to the bullpen for more work after being removed.
White Sox: RHP Steven Wilson (lower back strain) pitched a scoreless inning in a rehab appearance with Triple-A Charlotte.
Nathan Eovaldi (9-7, 3.79 ERA) starts for Texas in the series finale Thursday against White Sox right-hander Nick Nastrini (0-5, 8.39 ERA).
